title: That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSRE22-003, dated April 11, 2022, of the Interim Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report IPSRE22-003, dated April 11, 2022, of the Interim Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services.
That items 12.a.2, 12.a.4, 12.a.5, and 12.a.6 be approved as part of the Consent Agenda.
That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSCLK22-003 dated April 11, 2022, of the City Clerk, as follows: That the delegation from Michelle Ferreri, MP be received for information.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR22-003 dated April 11, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That the current Policy, attached as Appendix A to Report CLSHR22-003, be rescinded; and, b) That the amended General Employment Policy, attached as Appendix B to Report CLSHR22-003, be approved.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR22-003 dated April 11, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That the current Policy, attached as Appendix A to Report CLSHR22-003, be rescinded; and, b) That the amended General Employment Policy, attached as Appendix B to Report CLSHR22-003, be approved. That Council receive Report CLSCLK22-009 dated April 11, 2022, of the City Clerk, for information.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR22-003 dated April 11, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That the current Policy, attached as Appendix A to Report CLSHR22-003, be rescinded; and, b) That the amended General Employment Policy, attached as Appendix B to Report CLSHR22-003, be approved. That Council receive Report CLSCLK22-009 dated April 11, 2022, of the City Clerk, for information. That Council support Option Two of Report CSSS22-003, dated April 11, 2022, of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That $160,000 from the Social Services Reserve be issued to the DBIA to support a System Navigator position for a three year term. The term shall commence from the date of the signing of an agreement with the payments provided in three annual payments; b) That the Commissioner of Community Services be authorized to sign any required funding agreement documents with the DBIA, in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor; c) That the funding agreement specify: i) the negotiated program outcomes, ii) a collaborative approach be defined by the City and the DBIA, iii) reporting and evaluating processes, and that staff provide an update to Council in 15 months, and iv)That City staff be involved in the recruitment of the position.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR22-003 dated April 11, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That the current Policy, attached as Appendix A to Report CLSHR22-003, be rescinded; and, b) That the amended General Employment Policy, attached as Appendix B to Report CLSHR22-003, be approved. That Council receive Report CLSCLK22-009 dated April 11, 2022, of the City Clerk, for information. That Council support Option Two of Report CSSS22-003, dated April 11, 2022, of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That $160,000 from the Social Services Reserve be issued to the DBIA to support a System Navigator position for a three year term. The term shall commence from the date of the signing of an agreement with the payments provided in three annual payments; b) That the Commissioner of Community Services be authorized to sign any required funding agreement documents with the DBIA, in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor; c) That the funding agreement specify: i) the negotiated program outcomes, ii) a collaborative approach be defined by the City and the DBIA, iii) reporting and evaluating processes, and that staff provide an update to Council in 15 months, and iv)That City staff be involved in the recruitment of the position. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSAIR22-002, dated April 11, 2022, of the interim Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the report be received for information.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR22-003 dated April 11, 2022 of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services as follows: a) That the current Policy, attached as Appendix A to Report CLSHR22-003, be rescinded; and, b) That the amended General Employment Policy, attached as Appendix B to Report CLSHR22-003, be approved. That Council receive Report CLSCLK22-009 dated April 11, 2022, of the City Clerk, for information. That Council support Option Two of Report CSSS22-003, dated April 11, 2022, of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: a) That $160,000 from the Social Services Reserve be issued to the DBIA to support a System Navigator position for a three year term. The term shall commence from the date of the signing of an agreement with the payments provided in three annual payments; b) That the Commissioner of Community Services be authorized to sign any required funding agreement documents with the DBIA, in a form satisfactory to the City Solicitor; c) That the funding agreement specify: i) the negotiated program outcomes, ii) a collaborative approach be defined by the City and the DBIA, iii) reporting and evaluating processes, and that staff provide an update to Council in 15 months, and iv)That City staff be involved in the recruitment of the position. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report IPSAIR22-002, dated April 11, 2022, of the interim Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: That the report be received for information. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSIM22-004, dated April 11, 2022, of the Interim Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That the report be received for information; and b) That the resolution included in Appendix A to Report IPSIM22-004 be adopted, and c) That the circulation of the resolution include MPP Smith, AMO and other municipalities.

d) That a by-law be passed delegating to the Chief Administrative Officer and the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services certain authority respecting highways and parking within the downtown for the period May 1, 2022 to December 31, 2022 in the form of by-law comprising Appendix B to this report; and, e) That staff provide an update report to Council on any delegated authority decisions of staff related to the Downtown Built Environment Plan at General Committee in September 2022.
That this meeting adjourn at 8:58 p.m.
